result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mary E Cook

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Mary E Cook in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for plea/sentencing.  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in to case 15CT1419 for the purposes of sentencing.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until a Projected Guilty Plea and Sentencing in Branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mary E Cook in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Student Intern Morgan Wilz under the supervision of  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case in court with 15CM1419.  Court previously appointed attorney Plaisted.  Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. The court appointed Atty. Plaisted, present in court, to represent defendant in this matter. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense. Defense requests a status conference date.  All parties are advised effective August 3, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23, Room 515 of the Courthouse.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Status conference scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
Absolute Sobriety.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Mary E Cook in court.  Lovell Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 45.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 45 for a Scheduling Conference.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 7/24/15 @ 1:30 pm
